{{infobox character | people=[[Dwarves|Dwarf]] | name=Ibun | image= | caption | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[House of Ransom]] | affiliation= | language=[[Khuzdul]] | birth= | birthlocation= | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house=[[Petty-dwarves]] | parentage=[[Mîm]] | siblings=[[Khîm]] | spouse= | children= | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Ibun''' was the son of [[Mîm]] and brother of [[Khîm]], the last of the [[Petty-dwarves]].{{CH|7}}, p. 132 ==History== Ibun lived with his family at [[Amon Rûdh]]. They were seen by the [[Gaurwaith]] as they snuck past them carrying heavy sacks. Mîm was captured, and the two brothers fled into the mist. As they ran, Khîm was shot by a wild arrow from the outlaws, but Ibun survived, and shared his father's [[House of Ransom]] with [[Túrin]] and the outlaws. One winter, the two [[Petty-dwarves]] went out in search of roots, and were captured by a band of [[Orcs]]. To save his life Mîm betrayed Túrin to the [[Orcs]], but Ibun's fate is unclear.{{CH|8}}, p. 148 Much later, in [[Nargothrond]], Mîm told [[Húrin]], "I am the last of my people",{{S|Doriath}} meaning that he outlived both his sons; Ibun either lost his life at the hands of the Orcs, or in some later unrecorded mishap. ==Genealogy== {{familytree/start}} {{familytree| | | MIM | | |MIM=[[Mîm]]
